description: Proposed installation of 12no. antennas mounted on 6no. 3.15m high support poles, 3no. 0.3m microwave dishes & 1no. 0.6m dish, the installation of 6no. cabinets on grillage on the roof of the building and development ancillary thereto.
decision_conditions: REASON:  Due to their inappropriate siting and appearance, the proposed antennas and supporting structures would appear as dominant and discordant additions to the roof of the building within the sensitive location, and would therefore cause harm to the character and appearance of the host building,  The Bunhill Fields and Finsbury Square Conservation Area Conservation Area as well as the setting of adjacent Grade II Listed Finsbury Square. The public benefit of the equipment is not considered to outweigh the harm caused to the heritage assets. For this reason, the proposal is contrary to The National Planning Policy Framework 2019 (NPPF) together with policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2016,  CS8 and CS9 of the Islington Core Strategy 2011, policies DM2.1,  DM2.3, DM2.4 and DM2,7 of the Development Management Policies (2013) and the guidance contained within the Conservation Area Design Guidelines (2002), the Urban Design Guide (2017) and Finsbury Local Plan (2013).
